SEARCH
Module java.base
Package java.lang.template

Interface SimplePolicy<R>

Type Parameters:
R - Policy's apply result type.
All Superinterfaces:
TemplatePolicyPREVIEW<R,RuntimeException>
All Known Subinterfaces:
StringPolicyPREVIEW
All Known Implementing Classes:
FormatterPolicyPREVIEW
Functional Interface:
This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.
@FunctionalInterface public interface SimplePolicy<R> extends TemplatePolicyPREVIEW<R,RuntimeException>
SimplePolicy is a preview API of the Java platform.
Programs can only use SimplePolicy when preview features are enabled.
Preview features may be removed in a future release, or upgraded to permanent features of the Java platform.
This interface simplifies declaration of TemplatePolicysPREVIEW that do not throw checked exceptions. For example: 
SimplePolicy<String> concatPolicy = ts -> {
            StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
            Iterator<String> fragmentsIter = ts.fragments().iterator();
            for (Object value : ts.values()) {
                sb.append(fragmentsIter.next());
                sb.append(value);
            }
            sb.append(fragmentsIter.next());
           return sb.toString();
        });

    Chain template policies to produce a new policy that applies the supplied policies from right to left.

    apply

  • Method Details

    • chain

      @SafeVarargs static <R> SimplePolicyPREVIEW<R> chain(SimplePolicyPREVIEW<R> head, TemplatePolicyPREVIEW<TemplatedStringPREVIEW,RuntimeException>... tail)
      Chain template policies to produce a new policy that applies the supplied policies from right to left. The head policy is a SimplePolicyPREVIEW The tail policies must return type TemplatedStringPREVIEW.
      Type Parameters:
      R - return type of the head policy and resulting policy
      Parameters:
      head - last SimplePolicyPREVIEW to be applied, return type R
      tail - first policies to apply, return type TemplatedString
      Returns:
      a new SimplePolicyPREVIEW that applies the supplied policies from right to left
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if any of the arguments is null.
